page.title: 01North of the old cliff line
page.content: The south side of the block overlooks Romney Marsh and the English Channel. To the north the ground slopes down gently to the East Stour river with views of the downs. There are a few springs and brooks: drainage ditches surround many fields. The soil for the most part, overlies Kentish Ragstone; the north west corner is heavy clay. Ther are plenty of hedges and patches of woodland. Wildlife is varied Thriving in the quiet spots. The main livestock is sheep: beef cattle graze in the summer-shedded in winter. Poultry (hens turkeys) are kept inside.Airfield SE corner, established 1916, little used, being developed as an industrial estate. Nearby are relics of a pre WW2 fleet air arm camp. Agriculture provides some work: many are employed in nearby towns: A very few commute.
